elements.title: Guardian Caps
elements.contents: ... that the NFL has required players in most positions to wear Guardian Caps (pictured) during training even though third-party research has questioned their effectiveness?

elements.title: Watamou Lamien
elements.contents: ... that the Upper Voltan National Radio chief editor Watamou Lamien was the liaison between the ROC group of young radical military officers and the clandestine Voltan Revolutionary Communist Party?

elements.title: Silence Is Loud
elements.contents: ... that Silence Is Loud uses a style that was previously considered "absolutely verboten" for its genre?

elements.title: Jacob Green Jackson
elements.contents: ... that Jackson Demonstration State Forest was named in honor of American lumberman Jacob Green Jackson?

elements.title: Final Fantasy XIV: Dawntrail
elements.contents: ... that Tural, the setting of the expansion pack Final Fantasy XIV: Dawntrail, is inspired by Latin America and Southeast Asia?

elements.title: Adnan al-Bursh
elements.contents: ... that orthopedic surgeon Adnan al-Bursh had also served as an advisor to the Palestine national football team before dying in an Israeli prison?

elements.title: American Colossus
elements.contents: ... that American Colossus is a biography of a man who was "the most famous sportsman in the world" and "the most forgotten great athlete in American history"?

elements.title: Edward M.
elements.contents: ... that husband and wife Edward M. and Marie Zimmerman co-wrote the suffragist anthem "Votes for Women: Suffrage Rallying Song"?

elements.title: monitor payphones for vandalism
elements.contents: ... that between 1985 and 1988, Televerket spent 2 million kronor paying youth sports teams to monitor payphones for vandalism?
